TopicTitle: Using 360 Triggers as individual full axes instead of two half axes

Articles.Content:
Hello, I'm new to the forum but after a lot of searching I can't really find the answer I'm looking for, so I decided to post a new question.

I have a wireless 360 controller, and have been playing a lot of lunar flight lately with it. That gave me the idea to try to set my 360 controller up in a similar fashion for KSP. However when I assign the throttle axis to the right trigger, it only ranges from 50% to 100%, which can be a little problematic. I assume this is because the trigger only reports from 0 to 1 rather than -1 to 1 like any other axis would. Is there any way to have KSP interpret a value of 0 as a 0% throttle rather than 50%?

I'd rather not bind the two triggers onto the same axis like Workaround-for-Xbox-360-controller-Triggers-and-DPAD-mapping suggests.

I did notice in the settings.cfg file that there is a scale factor setting under AXIS_THROTTLE.


AXIS_THROTTLE
{
	name = Controller (Xbox 360 Wireless Receiver for Windows) 9
	id = joy0.9
	inv = False
	sensitivity = 1
	deadzone = 0
	scale = 1
	group = 0
	switchState = Any
}

If there is any way to change the offset too, I assume I could set the scale to 2 to get the full throttle range.

Any ideas would be appreciated.
